documents.document: .@10Ronaldinho: “I always tried to be a good influence on Messi and actually tried to do for him what @Ronaldo did for me. I felt embraced by @Ronaldo and I wanted Leo to have the same. He was very shy, but always a fantastic player.” https://t.co/hQKk68V8eG

ESPN: “His left foot is a magic wand, capable of deft flicks & impossible feats of dribbling that look as if the ball is attached to his boot. Passes that can bend the very fabric of space and time, and goals galore. Messi's favoured peg is beyond comparison in the modern game.” https://t.co/Q3iuLyvOaI

🚨 ¡NEW RECORD ALERT! 🚨
Lionel Messi breaks Gerd Müller's record of 365 league goals for a single club in Europe's top five leagues, by scoring his 366th goal in @LaLiga against @RealSociedad on January 14th, 2018.
CONGRATULATIONS, LEO! 👏 https://t.co/CRZfw2jKui
.@BleacherReport [on January 14, 2018]: “And then there was one.” https://t.co/GJfbALjLFw

.@RayHudson [on his commentary style]: “When we see Messi performing like he does, he does things that are so astonishingly ingenious, how do you find the framework to come around that? I go to a strange well of metaphors and over-the-top descriptions. It's insane, it's stupid!” https://t.co/T49OMNvExm

.@RayHudson [on @Cristiano and Messi]: “They are apples and oranges first of all. It's Iago and Othello. The two of them are total antagonists of one another in the sporting environment. You couldn't get them probably more diametrically opposing in many, many circumstances.” https://t.co/vBuhBIOPRi

.@RayHudson [on the differences between @Cristiano and Messi]: “@Cristiano, the penalty box predator — the anticipatory predator skill.
